subject: Politics
title: What Is Authoritarianism
description: A fast breakdown of What Is Authoritarianism for builders.

hook.text: Authoritarian rulers don't always seize power by force. Some win elections â€” then never lose again.

buildup.text: Authoritarianism concentrates power in one leader or a small group with few political freedoms.

discovery.text: Citizens have restricted rights. Opposition is suppressed. Media is controlled or censored.

twist.text: Some authoritarian states deliver growth. Singapore and China developed fast under tight control.

climax.text: The tradeoff is stability for freedom. Authoritarian states can act fast but crush dissent.

punchline.text: Authoritarian states offer order. The price is your voice.

quiz.question: What is a key characteristic of authoritarianism?
options: Power is concentrated with limited political freedoms
Power is shared equally among all citizens
Leaders are always chosen through military coups
